website_summaries.verdict: The Google OnHub makes it easy to bring dual-band 802.11ac networking to your home, but it's missing many of the management features you'd expect from a $200 router.

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine in the first month and then started to having ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought in January. Worked fine in the first month and then started to having issues. Restarted it A LOT OF times. Now one laptop could only connect to OnHub's guest network. When connect to the main network it will show "no internet, secured". Called google and went through a couple of simple tests and they said will follow up. I generally like google products, this one is a exception... a huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Problems with Apple Devices
customer_reviews.text: I like that this router is pretty much idiot proof out of the box. I'm a network engineer by trade and the last thing I want to do when I go home is to fiddle with another router, so I wanted something that was plug and play. This router is pretty close to that. My big complaint is that while using IOS devices, data seems to randomly hang. If I kill the wifi and switch to cellular, everything starts moving again. I tried static IPs with no improvement. This router also would not pick up an IP address from the provider when the XFinity modem was placed in bridging mode. I ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel M.

customer_reviews.title: WORTH EVERY PENNY!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device a little over 2 years ago and its performance has been flawless the features are outstanding the set up is easy and the signal strength is second to none, i have a clear connection all the way into my back yard where i have an outdoor rec area with smart tv and gaming which streams flawlessly at all times with several other devices connected inside and outside of my home, no need for any boosters this thing gets down with the get down!!! LMAO!!! Just buy it you wont regret it and if you buy it and are not pleased you probably cannot be pleased!!
customer_reviews.author: RHINOHUNTER

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Router/Network
customer_reviews.text: I decided to purchase the Google On-Hub now called Google WiFi router a few years ago. It didn't have the configuration which I was accustomed to for a modem but the throughput speed and stability more than make up for that. I did end up buying a few Google WiFi pucks to go with it and create a mesh to extend and now I have coverage everywhere including in our entire yard. This is the best router I ever bought before adding the pucks and once I added 2 Google WiFi pucks it became insanely fast and never drops connection. Literally. I have had it on for 6 months straight now and 0 drops in that time.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Wright

customer_reviews.title: Highly reccomend!
customer_reviews.text: My former roommate bought this router for us to use, and I was so impressed with it that I purchased the same one when he moved away. The set-up process was super simple using the Google Wifi app. The app also allows you to view your connection speeds and troubleshoot any problems you might experience (each time I've had a problem it has been an issue with my service provider, not this item). This is the most headache-free router I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Tony N

customer_reviews.title: Full signal all over house but no speed
customer_reviews.text: This thing is terrible I had much better results from free router from my service provider. Sitting right next to it in my bedroom gave me great speeds. Just the distance from there to my master bath drastically declined to almost nothing however showing full strength on my phone indicator. It will have to go back.
customer_reviews.author: Roderick B.

customer_reviews.title: Tech Support is very bad
customer_reviews.text: Everything was fine with the device until it wasn’t. Less than 6 months after the purchase it stopped working. Reset did not work. Called Google customer service. After numerous emails and receipt submission they said that I should contact TP link directly and they should replace the device. The only option with PT link was email exchange. After several days of back and forth emails they told me that Google should take care of the issue. So very disappointed because the quality of the device was good But the tech support sucks big time. I ended up purchasing another router and will never buy this brand ever again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great router.
customer_reviews.text: I have had a great experience with my OnHub in the 4.5 years I've had it. I was even able to get multiple Xbox One consoles working online on it despite other reviews saying only one would work simultaneously. It delivers consistently high speeds all over my house and even decent signal to the road in front of my house.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Maybe it would make a better vase?
customer_reviews.text: Setup was really user friendly and the app features are great but I have constant issues with it jamming the Wifi on IOS devices. Phones, iPads, Apple TVs I’ve emailed support through the link in the app twice with no response either time. If it didn’t take me months to finally unbox it and set it up I would definitely be returning it. I planned on expanding with the pucks but it’s no use if half of my devices at home are IOS. Update: still a piece of garbage. Never heard back from support....ever! I think instead of a vase it’d be better off as a trash can in the basement bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: johng

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Works Well! Has some questions about using with my Comcast modem (dory) and bridging the modem to support the OnHub, but called Google WiFi support and found excellent service. Got the router working and have faster speeds, better coverage and no sporadic outages or apparent "throttling" that I was getting using the Comcast router. I have a 2 story 2600 sqft home, the router is on the 1st floor and the farthest room on the 2nd floor has excellent coverage. Also "great" coverage on my backyard patio about 80' from the router. So far so good and glad I made the investment. Now if there was a way to find another ISP and customizable streaming TV I would be set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: There's a speaker at the top and it played a very cool "welcome, I am turned on
customer_reviews.text: This does not come with any instructions whatsoever. I literally had to google how to make it work which required internet and places you in a little chicken before the egg dilemma. It is very weird that you need bluetooth and wifi to set this up. I somehow managed to do it even though it failed to find a wifi point multiple times even though I was connected to it's setup wifi signal on my iPhone... There's a speaker at the top and it played a very cool "welcome, I am turned on..." like tune once I got it right. Other than that it is a very basic router that works decently.
customer_reviews.author: Himali Patel

customer_reviews.title: still not sure about this device yet. a work in progress
customer_reviews.text: I really don't know what to say about this thing. It's a wifi router and it advertises that a lot of people can connect to it. I bought it for that reason. I am 'expanding' my wifi devices and I need something that can handle the 'load'. I have the wifi outlets, for lamps, coffee pot, firesticks, tablets, phones, 3 of the Amazon devices, Echo, tap, dot. and even considering google device. I plan on adding wifi light switches in the near future. I'm still trying to figure out if this device can handle all of that. but so far, i have no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Todd

customer_reviews.title: Good signal, not good for wireless cameras!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t get it to work with my 4 wireless cameras, one ring doorbell. Tech support told me to call the manufacturers and get their port forwarding numbers. To no avail at getting any of them to work. Not good for 2.4gh cameras.
customer_reviews.author: CHUBBSNJ

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Charm for my 1400 sq ft Home!
customer_reviews.text: Works Like a Charm for my 1400 sq ft Home! I was overdue for an upgraded wi-fi router and figured I may as well get one with Smart capabilities. This one fit the bill after all of my research. Currently using a, along with the KASA app for Android. Waiting for a better price on a. Range of the router is VERY good, extending about 10 ft beyond the perimeter of my house. Full bars everywhere in the house. Recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it .... the wifi speed in my bedroom was about 80 to 90 mbps before with a google fiber speed 1 gigabite now with google onhub i get around 500mbps on my iphone 8 plus and everything else works really smoth thanks Google
customer_reviews.author: Hamid

customer_reviews.title: Great for novice users, but lack of advanced features leaves power users wanting more
customer_reviews.text: Great router for novice users. Simple set-up, good looking, and easy to manage via the phone app. However, the lack of advanced features, especially those related to security, is frustrating. You essentially have no control over your router; even something as simple as disabling SSID broadcast can't be done. Due to built-in hardware security, you can't run a custom firmware on it even if you wanted to modify soft settings. Overall, if you desire security, this isn't your router. If you desire easy setup and management, and a trendy looking router, this could be you. But for the price point... is it really worth it?
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: The router works flawlessly. The application provides useful information, and made setup a breeze. The IEEE 802.11ac technology eliminated connection issues I was having with my older IEEE 802.11n wireless router. I am also pleased to hear Google will continue to support the OnHub after releasing their new 'Google Wi-Fi' product - they will have the ability to function in tandem rather than OnHub being deprecated. I have only restarted the router once in the past five months, and I am not certain that was necessary as it was most likely the TV itself having issues (Android TV seems rather buggy in general).
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S. Mcpeters

customer_reviews.title: Fixed Weak Frontier Fios Signal
customer_reviews.text: This fixed my weak signal problems. My crappy Frontier Fios router/modem is now just being used just as a modem and the Google router works good with my Roku 3 rooms away. I had a bit of difficulty hooking it up because of the Frontier router/modem combo but the Google help line was fantastic, the best customer service I've experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi Ecklund

customer_reviews.title: Very great product in my perspective
customer_reviews.text: This baby is well worth the money! It's set up in the living room in the front of my house, and will reach to the back of my back yard (.3 acre property). I'd buy it again for sure! Also, has very intuitive setup (I work in network security so I know how to set up any other router securely and easily). It also does its own security patches/updates, and the phone app shows you the strength of your network and what devices are connected. Very great product in my perspective!
customer_reviews.author: CBerger

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding router, easy setup and has as advertised, long range and extremely fast down/uploading. One of my best purchases from the amazing Amazon and highly recommend this. I'm in a 2 story 1,600 sq. ft. condo and range is NO issue. With the integrated antennas, i no longer have a miniature alien being with antennas sticking out sitting on my television stand. Really an outstanding unit, nice job Google.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Router
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Looks cool - Easy to set up - Good speed if you are close to it - You can make your LED really dim if you have it in your bedroom, which is a VERY good thing! Cons: - It comes with 2 VERY VERY SHORT flat Ethernet cables... Its like they had a very good product and some a@@hole stood up and said - hey, lets make those two Ethernet cables really damn short... cuz, why not?! Bottom line: If you need a good simple router, buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Overall okay buy for most people
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this google wifi. It came packaged okay but had the only (not very detailed) instructions on the box lid. I am not very technology savvy but had it up and running in less than 30 minutes. It is compatible with 3.0 DOCSIS at least at the time of this review. I paired it with a separate modem to use with my comcast/xfinity cable company account. 5 stars overall -1 star for no step by step instructions and if you want to do more with a router than just a basic router, it is limited to a degree.
customer_reviews.author: just me

customer_reviews.title: This router is so much better. No problems since installing
customer_reviews.text: While I'm a techie at heart, my skills are somewhat lacking. Luckily, this router fits my needs perfectly. I had an Airport Extreme and always had compatibility issues (and constantly having to reset it). This router is so much better. No problems since installing, and it's been a workhorse. One note of caution: if you use VPN, this router is not VPN friendly. I use VPN for work, and while it does work, it's limited. Otherwise, if you just want a router that works and works well, this is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Miles S.

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line router for crowded wifi areas!
customer_reviews.text: Wow--this router solved all of the slow internet issues in my apartment!! I live in a high-rise (60 stories) and the wireless internet with my cheapo router(s) just couldn't compete with all of the other networks (25+ in range). My desktop went from 1-10 mbps download speed to 85!! Sure, this router only has 1 ethernet-out port (1 in from the modem, 1 out to 1 device = 2 total), but with wireless speeds pretty much on par with wired, who needs wired?!?! Setup was a tad clunky and I'm not sure that I'll ever hear the speaker on top again, but hey--it looks good and works even better. Nice packaging too! Reminded me of JW Blue label box haha
customer_reviews.author: Eric Burcham

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for 7 months and have no real complaints. Set up and connection was simple. The Google Wifi app makes this easy to customize and play with. I wish that you could turn the entire router off via the app instead of just pausing connected devices and it would be nice to be able to kick connected devices off your wifi as opposed to just being able to pause them but those are not real issues. The fact that it receives auto updates is nice as I theoretically should be protected with the most current patches.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: it works and its worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: It works! it is not delivering the speed that I thought it would, but its fast enough. I have three computers, one laptop, three tablets, three cellphones, and a printer on my wireless network. Everything is connected with no issues and my Internet speed is good. I can still play my computer games while 3 tablets are streaming movies/you tube with no lag for anyone. i would have given it 5 stars if the software gave me more control on which connections get priority and split my bandwidth accordingly. hardware is great, but software needs a bit of tweaking. Still a great buy IMO.
customer_reviews.author: JMA

customer_reviews.title: They stop working!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one a while back (Now my warranty is out) and it still routes, but the wireless function will no longer work. You can't get into the device any longer except by wireless, so if wireless won't work you can do anything with it. Before you buy, check some of the complaint web sites. I am not the only one with this issue. It has been this way for some time and seems to get worse with each update Google does. Check the Google Product Forums. Stay away from this one!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Henry Goldman

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing!!! I'm a network technician and I'm blown away buy it. It's easy to setup and it reaches every corner of my 3000 sqr ft (2 story) house. I can stop my kid from playing Xbox & PlayStation when I'm away from the house, and I don't know how it does it, but some how it syncs my wife's fitbit when she's not at home. I'm giving it 4 out of 5 stars because it only has 1 Ethernet port out. This won't bother most users but again I'm a network tech and somethings in my house still need to be hardwired.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth it!
customer_reviews.text: OMG!! So easy to set up, had a little struggle to remove the case from the Hub in order to plug in the wires. 1. Download the Google WiFi app 2. Once you connect the Hub go to WiFi networks on your phone, select the name of the Hub listed (you can locate the name at the bottom of the Hub). 3. Follow the prompts and you’re on your way. Streaming has been great since purchasing, I like that it identifies each device on your network and it gives you the ability to set up a guest Wifi network. Happy streaming 🤗
customer_reviews.author: JuliaM

customer_reviews.title: Great router at a steal!
customer_reviews.text: I've been very satisfied with this router. The speed throughout my home is incredibly fast, and I love how I can check in real time the usage on any connected device. I haven't fiddled much with the family settings (turning WiFi off for certain times, etc), but I imagine they will come in handy. The thing looks nice too (a little bigger than I expected), but the nice teal glowing ring gives it a very modern, decorative look. Would recommend! Far cheaper than many of the high priced routers out there, that's for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey T.

customer_reviews.title: Sends data to google
customer_reviews.text: This router will not work if it is not able to "phone home". It communicates certain information to google whether you want it to or not. If you block access to certain external IPs, this router's UI will cease to function. This is unacceptable to me. In addition all that, the wireless performance is quite poor.
customer_reviews.author: RadX

customer_reviews.title: Made my life much easier.
customer_reviews.text: I put one in our meeting room, and I am loving it. If my internet drops, it sends me a message. I can check it on my phone from anywhere to confirm that it is up and running. When we have guests in the meeting room, I can easily see how many devices are attached. I don't want to be the person that is always working with and tinkering with the network. I just want to know that it is working with little or no need for me to do anything. This has made my life much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great tech support via online chat and phone call. disapointed on wifi coverage in rear of house.
customer_reviews.text: Sleek design, that blends in without unsightly (and dust collecting) antennas. Very impressed with level of technical support getting the router up and running. I had hoped by bringing it to the first floor of our ranch house that I would have coverage in the back bedrooms, but that is not the case. Still have to use another booster.
customer_reviews.author: Art Kibby

customer_reviews.title: Something to think about
customer_reviews.text: It's been a fine router so far, I've had some connectivity qualms via Xbox and Apple products but more inconvenient than debilitating. One thing that should be considered is most smart devices only operate on 2.4Ghz and that makes it pretty tricky to set them up via the Onhub since it "intelligently" switches between 5Ghz and 2.4Ghz. Overall, I'll probably go with another router in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed. Unreliable connection.
customer_reviews.text: The router is probably one of the worst I have ever used. The connection constantly drops on almost every device. Speed is unreliable. Latency seems to be a hit or miss thing. I can not recommend at all. Stay away from this router and find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Polcha

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Companion to the Google WiFi system!
customer_reviews.text: After already having the Google WiFi setup, which I was little disappointed w since I had to set it up directly to the back of my service providers router which is located in my garage (ground floor) if my 3 level townhome, I couldn't be more happy with it. It allowed me to connect to the network wiring in the house, to maximize the supply to the middle floor, which I couldn't do w Google WiFi, by itself. Together it's a fabulous network companionship! I've included a screenshot of the connectivity history. The 2 oldest days were prior to the TP onHub being added. Since then, only one lower measured day at the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Bennett

customer_reviews.title: It's so simple, your parents can use it.
customer_reviews.text: I did not want to spend the money initially, but once I hooked it up, I beat myself up over trying other routers. I mean, sure... it doesn't have the DIY tweaks capability of other, cheaper routers. But ask yourself... do you really want to spend hours flashing software on the router and tweaking every detail of your setup meticulously to perfection? I mean, this is an idiot-proof router that will do all of that for you automatically for just an extra $50 and it will adapt to future problems, such as your annoying neighbor setting up a modem that messes with your wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: It turned out adding OnHub to existing mesh is not recommended
customer_reviews.text: I learned it hard way after purchasing it, but Google does not recommend using OnHub as mesh points. They suggest OnHub to be used as primary point only. See article "Adding OnHub as mesh Wifi point" on Google WiFi Help page. At the end, I was able to add OnHub as mesh node, but I had to factory reset the whole network and rebuild the network from scratch to form a mesh. It took some effort, but wifi connectivity is much better now.
customer_reviews.author: nonomori

customer_reviews.title: Broadens network access.
customer_reviews.text: Set up on this requires a smart phone. It is pretty easy. It seems to have sped things up farther away from the access point. 2200 square ft house with a second floor and no dead spots now. It replace several year old netgear. Tip when setting up: assign your old network name and password. Then you can avoid having to reset every device. I haven't used the kid controls, but the separate guest access is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria H

customer_reviews.title: Great style price and speed.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it’s not to big and it’s not ugly. I was nervous that it was going to be bigger then it looked online. It’s the same size as my old Apple router extreme. However each Apple router only lasted a year before it stopped working. This has been a great router so far for a good price and great range.
customer_reviews.author: halvie21

customer_reviews.title: No longevity
customer_reviews.text: I have a PS4 upstairs and lag was becoming a problem especially during peak hours. Prior to my purchase I tested out my signal strength through Google speed test and the results were very poor. --fast forward-- Shipment was here in 36 hours. Neatly package, Easy set up in no time, and great design. I get twice the signal strength upstairs now and 10x the speed downstairs. I do plan on buying 3 wifi points to extend coverage and boost speed from top to bottom. ------------------------ Update: Stop working after 8 months.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Don't know if there could be a better router, if there is I would like to ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't know if there could be a better router, if there is I would like to know what that one does. This is easy to set up, if you have a question (which I did) US Support is available 24/7 and great. Range is great, setting up devices is easier than any router I ever used. You will need to buy a $9 Ethernet Splitter since this only has one output (likely based on the units design). Sure hope this lasts but the investment seems to be worth it. I was done buying 70 dollar routers and replacing them every 3-4 years.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Great router, I have two covering a large home
customer_reviews.text: Great router, I have two covering a large home, one as a router, the other as a bridge, the signal is rock solid throughout. The connection always seems fast, and I don't have to worry about jumping from 2.4ghz to 5ghz networks. It has been a few weeks, and it does seem to 'just work'. One caveat, there is no USB port sharing, so if you had a printer or hard drive shared through your router, you'll need to find another solution, or a router that fits your needs. Also, this is not a power users router, if you like getting into the settings and really tweaking, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: J.R. Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Wireless WiFi Router
customer_reviews.text: Solved all our WiFi issues, so glad I listened to a colleague at work who recommended this device, one topic of discussion came up is that I have a one level home which is a major advantage as their maybe some signal issues if you live in a multi level home, IDK this is what the millennials went back and forth over .. bottom line it works in my ranch style home perfect! Last word of thought , you're never too old to learn about gadgets..
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Flexibility in controlling Wifi
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can pause certain devices and set schedules for wifi to turn off to devices or groups of devices. I haven't use it but you can also prioritize certain devices to get the best signal. I was hoping this would have a little better reach than my last router/modem combo but it is about the same. Coverage in the room furthest from the router (in a not-huge house) is spotty at best.
customer_reviews.author: J. Westpfahl

customer_reviews.title: Best router ever.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install. Very nice looking, up on a shelf for us so not an ugly router that needs to be hidden. So far we have had as many as 15 devices on it and it works perfectly as described. Nest, nest protect, drop cam, iPads, iPhones, Apple tvs and 3 IMacs. Zero delay full single through our 3k sqft home. Actually I was walking the dog and able to connect with the wifi three houses away. Network speed testing from all devices is very fast no more delays.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: I had to call technical support and they were super. Stayed on the phone with me the whole ...
customer_reviews.text: I've just gotten my device set up. Just in case you're as clueless as me, the blue cover lifts off. I twisted it and worked it back and forth (afraid I would break it!) and it finally came off. It is tightly fitted. That solved the mystery of where I was supposed to plug the other end of the power cord. I had to call technical support and they were super. Stayed on the phone with me the whole way and from that point on, it was clear sailing.
customer_reviews.author: infinite

customer_reviews.title: Great Router for The Tech Okay
customer_reviews.text: We hadn't given much thought to our wifi router, and things started to get dicey. Netflix lagging, Lots of devices and things got bad. This changed all of that, and was simple to put in place and we were off and running. The app lets you see what issues are effecting your signal, and we never have dropped shows and have to do the dreaded unplug/plug in, wait, do it again, annoying stuff! Good product, looks nice, and is really unobtrusive.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work on devices that with a 2.4GHz signal
customer_reviews.text: This puts out a good signal. My main problem with if, though, is that it only connects to devices that use 5GHz. I had to dig my old Netgear router out of the attic to run my 2.4 devices. Now I’m stuck with having to use 2 separate routers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonjunkie

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, easy to set up and configure.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This is the most powerful router I've used. It doesn't have a lot of the settings that power users are after, but for non-adepts at networking, it has everything needed to set up and configure for typical usage. It looks good, and you don't have to mess with switching between 2.4 and 5 ghtz I love that it monitors channel congestion from competing wifi networks, and will switch you to a less congested channel so you're not throttled by slower wifi connections on the same channel. Not only do I no longer have any weak signal areas inside my home, the wifi now reaches out into my yard, so I can stream music while I'm outdoors working or grilling
customer_reviews.author: Dean Buzzell

customer_reviews.title: The perfect router for 90% of the population
customer_reviews.text: Who wants to mess with a router settings on a regular basis? I guess less than 10% of the population If you are the other 90% you have to buy this router - it is amazing Some people had problems with ip cameras etc that will only work on 2.4 ghz. The fix is to set them up further away from the router because it automatically switches from 5 to 2.4 as the signal gets weaker. Hope that makes sense if not let me know I can explain further
customer_reviews.author: Marc Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed in this router
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed in this router. It would freeze up, show us offline in the app (while i was online), and couldn't tell a difference in the speed when it was working properly. Definitely not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Browning

customer_reviews.title: This is a good router. The set-up was a pain and needed ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good router. The set-up was a pain and needed a Android phone. The iPhone app never worked for set-up, though it can be used to control the device, once it is set-up. Good speed and accessibility throughout the home. It is better than my old Linksys AC3200! Though i now have both working. I haven't tested the TP-Link router with all the devices we have (like the advertisement shows). Poor set-up makes me take out 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: V. Vn

customer_reviews.title: Great product in custom built display.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this router! When I purchased this device I switch my ISP and I wanted a new stand for it and this router. So, I custom built my stand in the picture so the new router, modem and other display items fit well. I love this Google router and its so cool I can check my internet speed from my phone from anywhere, and I do mean anywhere. Software is very user friendly. I just have no complaints. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Ganymede

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy except I prematurely connected it to my PC (wired connection) before the setup and it confused it. Wait til after setup for that. Signal is strong, but I get 600mb/s through a wired connection and only 100-170 wirelessly. Shouldnt it be faster?
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Collin

customer_reviews.title: Best router I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: How they get such a good signal out of such an unassuming box is beyond me. At the extremities of the house where we were getting choppy signals at best we now get a consistent flow of data and full signal. App is a nice touch and is cool to be able to monitor it remotely.
customer_reviews.author: Greg vdm

customer_reviews.title: VERY EASY Setup - although I did have to google the ...
customer_reviews.text: VERY EASY Setup - although I did have to google the instructions. Would have been nice to have something included in the packaging. We had super slow internet that dropped us often. It appears to be working better with this onhub. we are pleased we took the plunge and spent the extra!
customer_reviews.author: JLPECO

customer_reviews.title: Continually stutters and drops connections when switching between 2.4 and 5 frequencies.
customer_reviews.text: Had it less than a week: it’s going back. Continually stutters and drops connections when switching between 2.4 and 5 frequencies. Can’t even scroll social media without images not loading. Have to switch back to LTE on my cellular to enjoy fast enough speeds, despite my 250 MBPS connection into my house. The plug is MASSIVE!!!! Had to rearrange my entire universal power supply just to get things to plug in. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Low unit life expectancy. No functioning dual band.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the Google home interface! Really wanted to love this router, but unfortunately it just wasn't up to snuff. Worked amazingly for about 6 months and then it just crapped it's pants. Wifi is not basically non functional. It started with the dual band capabilities and then went downhill until I couldn’t even open google docs without it failing completely. Very low life expectancy. Wish it would have crapped out earlier honestly, then it would have at least not outlived it's warranty. Poir purchase, would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: This Google OnHub is amazing! It has solved all my internet issues! I get 30+ mbps on my 40 mbps plan through wifi anywhere in my 1400 sf home. It was super easy to set up and love how it is all done through the phone. Hasn't needed a reboot once since I've set it up! Can't say enough about it. Totally recommended.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Less Than Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Neighbor had this and I can pick up his signal across the street in my backyard, so I figured it would be super strong. Got it hooked it up. Works ok, but can't get too far off my deck without loosing a signal, but I still can get neighbors. Also every now and then the signal will drop. Not a techie, but everything I look at (app, online) tells me it's working fine.
customer_reviews.author: RvS

customer_reviews.title: Dead Zones Gone!
customer_reviews.text: Set it up last night. Extremely simple set up, gives you some great options for parental control and allows some neat features for guest set up. Ran about 5mbs faster on both download and upload and best of all, the dead zone in my back bedroom is gone! Went from no coverage, to full signal strength using it.
customer_reviews.author: Poetic Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Works well for us
customer_reviews.text: It’s been a great router. I love the ability to control how the WiFi is used through the house. It seems like it’s good for gaming. We have too systems in the house. They both play just fine most of the time. Our internet package is basic so we have lag especially if a lot of people are trying to get on, but that’s not the router’s fault.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Herron

customer_reviews.title: Love this router, couldn't better except for more color options
customer_reviews.text: Swiss army knife of routers, impressive build quality and app control. I have no dropped connections and google keeps up with updates which is very important. I have had tplinks, dlinks, netgears and linksys routers. This was the most expensive but by far my favorite. I do not know how customer service is, because I had no need to call them. I had to call on all of my other routers. This one just works!!
customer_reviews.author: amzn

customer_reviews.title: Buy New! Not worth the headache of the preowned,or Used like new!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router,bought it like new, used. When it came time to install, it was never wiped clean of past data,and had to have a computer tech,clear out the router,so it could work for me! Works now,and it a awesome router, just pay the extra$10-$20 for the new one! Save yourself the headache. Otherwise would have gave it 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: but all in all it is a damn good product and pretty much plug and play
customer_reviews.text: I have an IT background and this is more meant for those that do not understand networking in my opinion, but all in all it is a damn good product and pretty much plug and play. For those of us that are used to tweaking everything for ourselves this really is not the product. Nice app for checking your network from your cell and having the ability to kick a device or ip remotely is kind of neat.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Borho

customer_reviews.title: Good not great.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it was easy cheesy to install. There is no doubt about that. However I do not feel like it gave me any more coverage than what I had before considering the price jump. I live in a 1300 sq. ft. house and I have a bedroom that drops like crazy. I was hoping this would ease that up by adding a bar or two. No such luck.
customer_reviews.author: Quintster

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it already. The lazy admin demands you buy it!
customer_reviews.text: So, I'm pretty uh, savvy. This has to be the simplest yet high performing piece of equipment I've ever had the pleasure of setting up. You do everything from the app. Everything. Guest network, done, Static IP's, done, Channel selection...wait what? It automatically does it, ok what about band selection... Whatttt? it does that too? F it. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Reel

customer_reviews.title: So easy!!
customer_reviews.text: So a router that is set up via an app is the best thing ever!! Download app and enter some numbers and holy crap thats it! The last router we had was a pain in the you know what! Also, on top of the easy setup, it works amazing and it looks awesome!! Netflix streams like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Jarbells

customer_reviews.title: Great router for ease of install and performance.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. If you haven’t updated your wireless router in a decade, this one was super easy and as you might hope a few of the newer gadgets have faster connections. Nothing magical, but much more consistent and no more resetting the router whenever my isp does something. It can even let you know when the network is down if you care.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: It’s easier to install & customize than most standard Routers.
customer_reviews.text: Since it’s set-up & customized from its smartphone App. And Google had good support most of the time I called them. But it doesn’t have as many customization options as some other major brands. Although most people won’t need more. And they are slowly adding more features with new App updates.
customer_reviews.author: A1 Computer Consulting

customer_reviews.title: Doing Great!
customer_reviews.text: Updated: 2016-04-12 - To be fair, I had to redo my review that I posted a couple of days about the OnHub dying on me. The only thing I can fault T-Link for is not having the power adapter cord "cat proof". :-/ The OnHub continues to work great for us (after replacing the cord). No rebooting like you have to normally do with the traditional routers. The WiFi range is better than our old Linksys and Apple Extreme routers. I miss some of the management functions a little but I am willing to trade that off if I don't have to deal with the headaches.
customer_reviews.author: WFCJ

customer_reviews.title: What a difference
customer_reviews.text: I read many,many reviews and did a lot of research before choosing Google OnHub. What a difference in connection! We struggled with two iPads connecting at the same time prior to changing to the OnHub. Now, we have the TV, two IPhones, two iPads, and our heat pump going through the router. No problems whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Instantly improved my connection speeds across devices
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this router, even devices at the edge of the single range are getting good speeds. Let me get rid of wifi-extenders and just have the single router now. App control is great, havent tried to setup DMZ yet but I hope its as easy as everything else. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: MVB Creations

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. One complaint
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. One complaint: the download speed from the hub to my iphone was not displayed as a number, only as "good'. And the download speed to the hub is unbelievable - really - shows as "more than 200 Mbps." But much better signal strength everywhere in my one-story house of 2000 sq ft. Hub in my bedroom on a shelf, at one end of the house
customer_reviews.author: R. MCBAIN

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link OnHub works great as a mesh WiFi Point
customer_reviews.text: I have had OnHub by Asus for a few years now and i'm pretty happy with it. In my house it provides good signal for the exception of 2 rooms that are in the opposite side of the house. To remedy that, i bought this OnHub by TP-Link and set it up as as a wifi point, basically created a mesh network. No more blind spots and the coverage/speed is awesome!! If you want to save a few bucks, i recommend to go with OnHubs rather than with Google WiFi pucks.
customer_reviews.author: Katrulya

customer_reviews.title: WORKS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my Google router is in the basement and we are three stories. I have it in the upper most part of the house. Easy to set up. I have mine in bridge mode, direct wired. It is much stronger than my old trend net device. Very good bars everywhere in the house. I plan on adding another one downstream at the far end near the garage to pick up remote security cams. TP- Link does stuff right.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: I can control the router state very easily through the app
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router to boot my home WiFI speed. Overall, it works well. I can control the router state very easily through the app. But sometimes, we find that the iPad/iPhone is not connected to the Internet, even the WiFi is connected, the quick solution we figured out is that disable the WiFI on the device first, then enable it, connecting to WiFI router again. It's a little annoying.
customer_reviews.author: MikeY

customer_reviews.title: Finally eliminated all deadspots
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and signal strength is much improved over the crappy wireless gateway I got from Xfinity (yes I know, a low bar), I finally eliminated all the deadspots in my house. This when the Onhub is actually placed right next to the Xfinity wireless gateway.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bhowmick

customer_reviews.title: BEST router out there!!
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely one of the BEST wifi routers out there!! I had one in my 2nd home where the internet isn't so great, and it did help. Bought a 2nd one for my everyday home where the internet is much better, and it made an even bigger difference! I was having problems with the connection going in and out on my old router. With this one, I have had ZERO trouble since installing! My speeds even doubled. I'm only paying for 50mps but my speed tests are all coming out at 113mps!! This is a quality product! Google is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Gene Lapete

customer_reviews.title: Good Replacement
customer_reviews.text: Had an older AirPort Extreme and decided to replace it with the OnHub. Like a lot fo the features. Not sure the range increased within the house. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: John Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Defective, but outside of return period
customer_reviews.text: Finally got around to setting it up. After going through setup and connecting a device to wifi the Google Router's SSID disappeared and the device was bricked. Had to hard re-set it and would need to set it up again. Filing a claim to return it. Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: 5ghz and 24ghz bands use the same SSID. No web interface.
customer_reviews.text: The product does provide reliable signal to my 1600sqft house, with no weak spots. That said, I'm disappointed in the decision to use the same SSID for both 2.4ghz and 5ghz bands and not give the user any control over this. It's caused some issues with devices where I'm unable to troubleshoot by switching bands, since the client device only sees one SSID. Also, only being able to configure the network by an Android device works for me, but I'd like to have a web interface with deeper options.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary B Mowrey

customer_reviews.title: Works great, Easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: The On-Hub was very easy to set up. Using the app it took only a minute. While the range of the device always depends on the configuration of the rooms it is being used in, my usable range was increased quite a bit over what I had. The On-Hub app allow me to set up the device, add a guest account, and track the devices using the wireless signal. Only time will tell how it works over time, I would recommended the On-Hub to anyone who wants a easy to set up wireless router.
customer_reviews.author: Lew

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase
customer_reviews.text: Omg this router is awesome. I have told everyone about it. The parental controls to turn off certain things is so useful. Best purchase ever!!!’
customer_reviews.author: Maisha J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Easy
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an old single band ASUS router with this Google OnHub. Easy to set up except that the documentation did not clearly how explain how to give a hard-wired networked device a fixed IP. This process is easy for wireless devices, but only a lot of cussing and googling revealed that you have to restart router in order to give a hard wired device a fixed IP.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Innovation and simplicity
customer_reviews.text: Simple setup and replaced my links Linksys ea4500 which wasn't handling all the devices in my house. I have seen many complain about the lack of ports I only have a Verizon extender so I only need one port love the app and love the speeds I am seeing on WiFi It does take 15 to 20 minutes for the best signal upon set up but once it locks in speeds for me are double and triple what I had been pulling Love the app that comes with it
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Wireless perfection
customer_reviews.text: This is the ticket. Works great. I have purchased several routes that say they have enough coverage for a large house with poor service zones. This router really works. Best one in 15years of trying extenders ect. This is the purchase that solved my wireless issues.Amazon gives you the right to return this. You won't!
customer_reviews.author: Juju musica

customer_reviews.title: Best internet speed and coverage of any router!
customer_reviews.text: This router is amazing. It was easy to set up and my internet download and upload speed is the best it has ever been. Our home is 2300 sq. ft. and we have coverage throughout the house. The only item I would point out to potential smart home users is that Kasa and Wemo plugs use 2.4 gHz for their smart plugs. They do not work with the Google OnHub. However, I was able to use my older router and hook it "in series" with this one and I'm now able to use these smart plugs.
customer_reviews.author: STL Cards Fan

customer_reviews.title: Fast. Enough said.
customer_reviews.text: My first unit was defective, after getting that straight and getting a new unit connected, I have no complaints. We have easily over 20 devices connected to the network and they all work without issue. Our speeds are 150mbp/s from across the house. It was tricky setting this up with Fios but the google support teams are fast and extremely knowledgeable. Great router.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter A.

customer_reviews.title: Been a year now. I don’t think this router ...
customer_reviews.text: Been a year now. I don’t think this router is pushing the speeds it’s supposed to. Google test shows low 50-80mbps. I pay for 250mbps. Online tests show 300mbps. iPhone shows 45mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Lud

customer_reviews.title: The best router you can control with just an app
customer_reviews.text: The best, spectacularly easy to work with router. Amazing 13-antenna array allowed me to eliminate two additional range extenders in my house. The app that controls it is super-simple. Updates happen automatically, so your Wi-Fi stays secure and up-to-date with the latest features. Works with IFTT and now the Phillips HUE lights. Pretty soon, this will be your gateway to everything Google Home (and Cast-enabled devices) will bring.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Babel

customer_reviews.title: Good router but no dmz for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Good router, easy to install. The ability to see anyone connected to your router from the app, even when you aren't home is nice. My complaints are no dmz and limited port forwarding options. So for gaming, especially with the ps4 which is known for lag without setting up dmz, this router isn't the greatest. As far as connection, speed, and range this router is at the top of the class.
customer_reviews.author: girltechie

customer_reviews.title: Garbage -won't stay connected.  Won't project wifi around corners. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Can't stay connected to the internet. Drops out a lot. Very poor performance. Take a long time to make the initial connection/handshake. So it's really bad for mobile devices. My 5-yr-old Airport Extreme worked way better even though the specs are not as good. First time I needed more than one wifi router to cover my home.
customer_reviews.author: Orion Willow Parrott

customer_reviews.title: Must buy insurance bc it will just die
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy it unless you buy insurance on this because OnHub has a very short life span. Mine died less than 2 years. Because it’s dead outside of the 1 yr manufacturer warranty, no help was offered except that I should just buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great router! It was so easy to set up in the app. It also allows you to have a "guest Wifi" and pause it as necessary. Can also set up family-friendly browsing. I have Cox internet and used a Netgear router.
customer_reviews.author: whatpaigeesaid

customer_reviews.title: Wifi does not work 6 months after purchase
customer_reviews.text: The wifi stopped working reliably. My phone is constantly dropping the connection to the network and will not rejoin, I get incorrect password errors. My ps4 cannot connect either, with similar errors. I will try to get a replacement through the warranty but I'm pretty disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: An excellent value
customer_reviews.text: By far the simplest router I've ever set up. Download the app and it guides you through the process. I was finished in 10 minutes and that included the time I spent opening the Google Router box and the wait while the app downloaded on my iPad. The range is more than I needed. I bought this one for my office. When the Apple AirPort Extreme at home dies I'll probably replace it with this router.
customer_reviews.author: txbbc

customer_reviews.title: BEST ROUTER IN THE WORLD!!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recomended! this router is just the future! - Never need to rest! - Auto update and firmware installation. - Easy setup. - High Speed, and i mean great speed! - Great coverage. I wish everything was the same concept as this little guy!
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad

customer_reviews.title: Truffle Butter
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic device!! I have only owned it for a few hours but it has already boosted my signal tremendously! I replaced a router that was from 2010 so I never knew what I was missing until I installed this beast. Super easy to set up and the app is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Scion Selfie

product_meta.title: OnHub Wireless Router from Google and TP-LINK, Color Blue
product_meta.description: Meet OnHub, the router from Google and TP-Link that’s built for fast Wi-Fi on all your devices. OnHub provides Wi-Fi speeds up to 1900 mbps to help with smooth streaming, gaming, and downloading. Its unique design and 13 antennas provide reliable speed in every direction, covering up to 2,500 square feet. And OnHub can connect 100+ devices at the same time, so everyone can enjoy what they love to do online.
feature_bullets: The companion Google Wifi app makes setup simple and lets you to control your network from your smartphone
Super fast Wi-Fi speeds up to 1900 mbps to help with smooth streaming, gaming and downloading
Helps eliminate dead zones with 2.4GHz and 5GHz Band1/2/3/4 Wi-Fi antenna-13, 2.4GHz Bluetooth antenna- 1 & 2.4GHz Zigbee antenna-1. Reliable coverage for most homes up to 2,500 square feet
Supports 100+ connected devices, so everyone can get on at once and signal rate- Wi-Fi 5GHz is Up to 1300Mbps,2.4GHz is Up to 600Mbps, Bluetooth is 4.0&HS
Supports 100+ connected devices, so everyone can get on at once and signal rate- Wi-Fi 5GHz is Up to 1300Mbps,2.4GHz is Up to 600Mbps, Bluetooth is 4.0&HS
A separate guest network helps get friends online easily, and allows you to share devices, like your Chromecast, with them.
Industry-leading 2-year warranty and 24/7 premium technical support.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
